Access to affordable childcare is critical to keeping women in the workforce. Supporting places like the Lakeland Hills Family YMCA means supporting working parents throughout our community.

It is estimated that almost 1.6 million mothers have left the workforce due to COVID-related school closures and the labor force participation rate of mothers with school-age children fell by almost 5 percentage points when the first wave of school closures hit the country.

The ARP provides an additional $39 billion in relief funding for the child care sector, for a total of $50 billion across all of the coronavirus relief bills. This means an estimated $695 million in childcare related relief coming to New Jersey from the ARP!

I sat down w/ CEO Alex Martinez, Associate ED Marianne Lomauro, Mountain Lakes Mayor Tom Menard & Deputy Mayor Lauren Barnett to discuss the Y’s community programs, how they reopened childcare programs safely, & how the #AmericanRescuePlan supports childcare & school reopenings.

Lie ❌ Georgia banned food and beverage from being handed out to voters in long lines. 

Fact ✅ Georgia strengthened laws against electioneering at polling precincts. Poll workers can distribute food and beverage to voters waiting in line. New York has almost the same exact ban

Fact ✅ Georgia has had a photo ID requirement to vote since 2005, and voter turnout among all groups has soared.  California (four MLB teams), Colorado (reported new site of MLB All-Star Game), all have laws requiring ID for mail-in votes.

Fact ✅ Early voting begins 17-days before an Election in Georgia. New York and the President’s home state of Delaware all have shorter timeframes to early vote. 

Lie ❌ Georgia mail-in ID requirement will suppress turnout.

Here are some of the GA lies versus the GA facts:

Lie ❌ GA restricted early voting.

Fact ✅ GA vastly expanded early voting. In the 2020 Election, more than 100 counties did not have any early voting at all. The new law requires at least two weekend days of early voting.

...help millions of graduates who are struggling with this major debt burden. I encourage employers in #IL and across the U.S. to consider offering this benefit to their employees. Programs like these will help grow our economy while reducing student debt in a responsible manner.

My proposal simply builds on this private-sector approach to addressing the student loan debt crisis in this country by allowing this benefit to be tax-free to both the employee and the employer. This innovative approach has the potential to be the 401(k) of student loans and...

Student debt is the second highest form of consumer debt and prevents many in the workforce from fully contributing to our economy. Some companies have found that offering a benefit to help employees pay down loans has allowed them to recruit and retain young talent.

Today I spoke with members of the McLean County Chamber of Commerce about my Employer Participation in Repayment Act, which allows employers to offer tax exempt student loan payments to their employees, up to $5,250/year.

You can read more about it here:
https://rodneydavis.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=404048
